Normally I like to test my abstract classes separately from any
concrete im=
plementations I might have. I might have something like this:

public abstr=
act AbstractThingy {
  // some concrete methods in here that need testing
 =
 ...
}

Based on this, I would name my test class: AbstractThingyTest
(alth=
ough it's not abstract itself).

When I run JUnit in Eclipse, everything is=
 fine and dandy. Running it
from within Maven however seems to make this te=
st not run. So I tried
renaming the test to simply: ThingyTest. When I run =
this, it does in
fact run.

Anyone else encountered something similar? I su=
spect it's a bug and it
should be looking for the keyword "abstract" instea=
d of any file or
class with the word "Abstract" in it.

Thoughts?

Josh
